comments:
Hi,

I use eclipse SDK-M20060921 together with cdt-4.0.0-I200609180500 and got
an internal error which seems to be related to the old CDT language pack I found. (That's at least what I guess from
sun.text.resources.LocaleElements_de.getContents(LocaleElements_de.java:34))

My java version is "1.4.2_11-b06".

I have dozends of other errors which I cannot analyse. Do you think it's useful to report these too? They could be not related to CDT (unlikely, since CDT is the most unstable component on my system) ...

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-09-22 15:11:15.253
!MESSAGE W?hrend "Startvorgang l?uft" ist ein interner Fehler aufgetreten.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException

There are updated language packs available for certain languages in bug #167922.  Can you try that out and see if it helps?

Sorry for beeing silence such a long time. I started again using eclipse but because of all the problems/crashes/... I had last time I use now 3.3M5eh
together with CDT 4.0.0-M5.

http://www.eclipse.org/cdt/downloads.php contains:

These translations are based on the CDT 3.1.1 build but should work with all subsequent 3.1.x maintenance releases. If new strings are added to CDT after 3.1.1, they will not show up as translated in the 3.1.x stream when you install this language pack.

I wonder about "subsequent 3.1.x maintenance releases". Does this mean it's not a good idea to install it with 4.0.0? I really hesitate remembering the problems I had ...
I know gettext based translations attempts very well but nothing about java!

PS: Where is the source of the translations (CVS repository)? I want to fix all typos I will find.

You can still give the 3.1.1 language pack a try on CDT 4.0.  There have been a lot of moving around in 4.0.  Needless to say CDT 4.0 introduced many new strings as well so chances are the 3.1.1 language pack might not be very useful.

There will be a language pack for CDT for 4.0 and it should be available pretty soon after 4.0 is officially released.  You might want to wait for that.

As for the source, they are just properties files.  If you want more information on how the translations are organized within the plugins, you can look at this document:

http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Internationalization/how2I18n.html

If you see any spelling mistakes or typos please report them on bugzilla.  Thanks.

I tried the current language packs (for eclipse and CDT) and both are currently nearly useless with the development snapshots. I needed to search
5 minutes to find a single translated string. A Po file based system is definitevely not so ineffective since basic strings did not change ("Edit", "Open", ...).

Maybe I will try to extract new property files from CVS. I hope they are not distributed across all CVS modules.

> If you see any spelling mistakes or typos please report them on bugzilla. 
> Thanks.

Of course! But first I normally search for multiple occurances via "grep", apply my set of scripts, ... I often check many important sources (Linux manual pages, Debian Website, large collections of PO files ...) in parallel with found issues. This is very efficient.

Hi Jens,

I'm going through the list of bugs I subscribed to and I saw this bug...unfortunately there won't be new translation package for CDT 4.0.  A new Eclipse project called Babel has been proposed and new translations will be made available through it:
http://www.eclipse.org/proposals/babel/

If you have any questions please let me know.  Thanks.
Vivian
